page.title: 03POPULATION
page.content: In 1951 the population of{Wickford}was 8000 .This had risen to nearly 22000 in 1971 and over 26000 by 1981. This being despite a falling birth rate and a stable death rate. However since 1960 between 1000 and 1500 persons per year have moved into the district. A survey by the council in 1968 showed that over 60% of houseowners had not been born in the town, compared with 37% for the whole of{South Essex.} There is an evenly distributed age structure without any significant peaks putting a strain on services. In a class survey of 4th year pupils at {Bromfords school,}9 out of 18 had moved to{Wickford}and only one pupil's parents were native to the town. 12 pupils' parents had moved from London, 5 from other parts of{Essex}and one from Yorkshire.
